  "overview": "This bill is an act making appropriations for claims against the State, its officers, or its employees. [CHUNK_0] The purpose of this measure is to satisfy several claims against the State, its officers, or its employees. [CHUNK_39] The bill makes appropriations and approves payments for claims against the State, its officers, and its employees. [CHUNK_34]",
  "appropriations": "For fiscal year 2024-2025, the bill appropriates $7,023,343.07 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii, $1,320,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) out of the state highway fund, and $90,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) out of judiciary funds. [CHUNK_1, CHUNK_18, CHUNK_22, CHUNK_17, NUMBER_92, CHUNK_20, NUMBER_100, CHUNK_23, NUMBER_104] These sums are to satisfy claims, judgments, and settlements for various individuals and entities, such as $69,113.33 (HB990_CD1_CCR132_.htm.txt) for a claim by Gilbert Collins and $70,000.00 (HB990_CD1_CCR132_.htm.txt) for a settlement in the case of Susanna Sigal v. State of Hawaii. [CHUNK_39, NUMBER_114, CHUNK_46, NUMBER_128] The appropriated sums are to be expended by the department of the attorney general, the department of transportation's highways division, and the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [CHUNK_17, CHUNK_21, CHUNK_24]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The sums appropriated are for the purpose of satisfying claims for legislative relief as to named persons, firms, corporations, and entities. [CHUNK_2] The amounts are for payments of judgments or settlements, or other liabilities. [CHUNK_3] The specific amounts are set forth opposite their names in the bill, representing the determined value of each claim, judgment, or settlement. [CHUNK_3]",
  "agency_impact": "The sums appropriated from general revenues shall be expended by the department of the attorney general for the purposes of this Act. [CHUNK_17] The sums appropriated from the state highway fund shall be expended by the department of transportation, highways division. [CHUNK_21] Departments shall obtain the approval of the attorney general before payment of any claim may be made. [CHUNK_30]",
  "economic_impact": "The appropriations contained in this Act will cause the general fund expenditure ceiling for fiscal year 2024-2025 to be further exceeded by $7,023,343.07 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt), or one per cent. [CHUNK_27, NUMBER_113] The reasons for exceeding the general fund expenditure ceiling are that the appropriations made in this Act are necessary to serve the public interest and to meet the needs addressed by this Act. [CHUNK_28] Payment of interest upon judgments against the State shall be limited to the period from the date of the judgment, if applicable, to thirty days after the effective date of this Act. [CHUNK_31]",
  "policy_impact": "This Act makes appropriations to satisfy claims against the State, its officers, or its employees. [CHUNK_0] It declares that the general fund expenditure ceiling for fiscal year 2024-2025 has been exceeded, stating the reasons are to serve the public interest. [CHUNK_25, CHUNK_28] The Act includes a severability clause and specifies it shall take effect upon its approval. [CHUNK_33, CHUNK_34]",
  "revenue_sources": "The sums are appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [CHUNK_1] Additional funds are appropriated out of the state highway fund. [CHUNK_18] The bill also appropriates sums out of the judiciary funds. [CHUNK_22]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The appropriations in this Act are designated for fiscal year 2024-2025. [CHUNK_1] All unexpended and unencumbered balances of the appropriations made in this Act as of the close of business on June 30, 2026, shall lapse. [CHUNK_32] The appropriations are for specific, non-recurring payments of judgments and settlements. [CHUNK_3] For example, a subtotal of $1,021,738.39 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) is allocated for miscellaneous claims, and $2,645,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) is for claims related to the Department of Education. [CHUNK_5, NUMBER_20, CHUNK_10, NUMBER_50] A subtotal of $1,320,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) from the state highway fund is for claims against the Department of Transportation, Highways Division. [CHUNK_20, NUMBER_100] A subtotal of $90,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) from judiciary funds is for a settlement in the case of Leanne Rosa v. Randal G.B. Valenciano. [CHUNK_23, NUMBER_108] The Act addresses specific liabilities for FY 2024-2025 and does not establish ongoing programs or recurring costs beyond the lapse date. [CHUNK_32] The legislature has determined that at the beginning of the regular session of 2025, the general fund expenditure ceiling for fiscal year 2024-2025 was exceeded by $8,551,795 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_25, NUMBER_110] Act 1, Session Laws of Hawaii 2025, caused the ceiling to be further exceeded by an additional $30,334,159 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_26, NUMBER_111] This Act will cause the ceiling to be further exceeded by $7,023,343.07 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_27, NUMBER_113]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "This measure does not generate new operating revenue. [CHUNK_1] It appropriates funds from existing revenue sources, including general revenues, the state highway fund, and judiciary funds. [CHUNK_1, CHUNK_18, CHUNK_22]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "This Act makes appropriations for claims, judgments, and settlements. [CHUNK_0] There are no capital expenditures identified in the bill. [CHUNK_3] The funds are for satisfying liabilities and are not designated for investments in facilities, equipment, or infrastructure. [CHUNK_2]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "All unexpended and unencumbered balances of the appropriations made in this Act as of the close of business on June 30, 2026, shall lapse. [CHUNK_32] The bill addresses specific, one-time liabilities for claims, judgments, and settlements. [CHUNK_3] There are no ongoing fiscal obligations created by this Act that would extend beyond the lapse date. [CHUNK_32]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "This fiscal note reflects the final version of the bill after the Conference Committee, which amended the measure. [CHUNK_39] The Committee appropriated specific amounts for various claims, including $69,113.33 (HB990_CD1_CCR132_.htm.txt) in general funds for a claim by Gilbert Collins and $70,000.00 (HB990_CD1_CCR132_.htm.txt) out of the state highway fund for a settlement in the case of Susanna Sigal v. State of Hawaii. [CHUNK_39, NUMBER_114, CHUNK_46, NUMBER_128] The Committee also amended the amount and percentage of exceedance of the appropriations over the general fund expenditure ceiling for fiscal year 2024-2025 and changed the effective date to upon approval. [CHUNK_46, CHUNK_47] The bill specifies total appropriations of $7,023,343.07 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) from general funds, $1,320,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) from the state highway fund, and $90,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) from judiciary funds. [CHUNK_17, NUMBER_92, CHUNK_20, NUMBER_100, CHUNK_23, NUMBER_104]"
}

the sums hereinabove stated as interest upon judgments against the State, payment of interest shall be limited to the period from the date of the judgment, if applicable, to thirty days after the effective date of this Act, as provided in section 662-8, Hawaii Revised Statutes, for those cases to

SECTION 8. If any provision of this Act, or the application thereof to any person or circumstance, is held invalid, the invalidity does not affect other provisions or applications of the Act that can be given effect without the invalid provision or application, and to this end the provisions of

provision or application, and to this end the provisions of this Act are severable. SECTION 9. This Act shall take effect upon its approval. H.B. No. 990, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR CLAIMS AGAINST THE STATE, ITS OFFICERS, OR ITS EMPLOYEES," having met, and after full and free discussion, has agreed to recommend and does recommend to the respective Houses the final passage of this bill

to the respective Houses the final passage of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure is to satisfy several claims against the State, its officers, or its employees. Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by: (1) Appropriating: (A) $69,113.33 in general funds for a
